sage.scene

Class Leaf

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Leaf
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cube, Cylinder, HUDObject, Line, Polygon3D, Polyhedron3D, Sphere, TriMesh

    public abstract class Leaf
extends SceneNode
    This class is an abstraction for SceneNodes which are leaves of the gameworld scenegraph; it defines functionality common to all types of scenegraph Leaf nodes. Concrete types of Leaf nodes should extend this class and define type-specific properties within the subclass.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class sage.scene.SceneNode

        SceneNode.CULL_MODE, SceneNode.RENDER_MODE

      protected BoundingVolume localBound
      Holds the local-space BoundingVolume for the Leaf; that is, a BoundingVolume defined in local coordinates.

    • Field Detail

      • localBound

        protected BoundingVolume localBound
        Holds the local-space BoundingVolume for the Leaf; that is, a BoundingVolume defined in local coordinates. Subclasses should update this field when the model data changes.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Leaf(java.lang.String name)

        Constructs a new Leaf with a default name and default values as specified by Leaf(String).

    • Method Detail

      • setLocalBound

        public void setLocalBound(BoundingVolume bv)
        setLocalBound() sets the local bounding volume of this Leaf to the specified BoundingVolume.
        Specified by:
        setLocalBound in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        bv - - the new bounding volume for this Leaf.

      • getLocalBound

        public BoundingVolume getLocalBound()
        getLocalBound() returns the local BoundingVolume object for this Leaf.

      • updateLocalBound

        public abstract void updateLocalBound()
        updateLocalBound() computes a new local bounding volume for this Leaf by re-examining the vertex data for the leaf. This method is specified by this class (and also by the parent SceneNode class) but must be implemented by any derived classes since the abstract Leaf class can't know what the subclass data looks like (and hence can't know how to compute the bounding volume).
        Specified by:
        updateLocalBound in class SceneNode

      • updateWorldBound

        public void updateWorldBound()
        Computes a new world bound for this Leaf by multiplying the Leaf's local bound by the Leaf's world transformations. If the local bounding volume is null, nothing is done.
        Specified by:
        updateWorldBound in class SceneNode

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(IRenderer r)
        draw() draws the graphical representation of this Leaf. This method is specified by this class (and also by the parent SceneNode class) but must be implemented by any derived classes since the abstract Leaf class can't know how to draw the subclass object. Subclasses are expected to make a "callback" to the specified IRenderer object to draw the object in a graphics API-dependent way.
        Specified by:
        draw in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        r - - the IRenderer to be used to draw this Leaf.

      • predraw

        public boolean predraw(IRenderer r)
        predraw() contains any code which should be executed immediately prior to rendering this Leaf object; it is intended to be called just before invoking a renderer to start drawing this Leaf. If it returns false, the application typically will skip rendering (although this is not a requirement). The default predraw() implementation in this class returns true (and takes no other action); subclasses can override this method to control how predraw() actually affects rendering.
        Parameters:
        r - - the IRenderer which will ultimately be used to draw this Leaf.

      • postdraw

        public void postdraw(IRenderer r)
        postdraw() is intended to be called just after the renderer finishes drawing this Leaf. The default implementation in this class performs no operation; subclasses can override the method to control post-rendering operations.
        Parameters:
        r - - the IRenderer which was used to draw this Leaf.

      • applyRenderStatesToSceneNode

        protected void applyRenderStatesToSceneNode(java.util.Stack<RenderState>[] states)
        applyRenderStatesToSceneNode() assigns the RenderState at the top of the stack in each entry in the incoming array of stacks to be the RenderState for this Leaf node. If the incoming array has no entry for a particular RenderState.RenderStateType then a default value is assigned.
        Specified by:
        applyRenderStatesToSceneNode in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        states - An array of stacks, one stack for each type of RenderState

      • getTexture

        public Texture getTexture()
        This method is intended to return the Texture object currently attached to this sage.scene.Leaf, if any. It is currently unimplemented and throws an exception if invoked.
        Returns:
        the Texture attached to this Leaf

      • setTexture

        public void setTexture(Texture texture)
        Attaches the specified Texture to this Leaf. Attachment is done by creating a RenderState.RenderStateType.Texture wrapping the specified Texture and assigning the RenderState to the set of RenderStates associated with this node. If any Texture was previously attached to this Leaf it is removed (although it remains in the TextureManager's cache if it was there in the first place).
        Parameters:
        texture - - the texture to be assigned to this Leaf node.
